snippet: The plan is the first in a series of labor- and immigrant-friendly laws that Mayor Bill de Blasio is expected to champion, including higher pay for employees on many city-sponsored projects.
abstract: New York City's top elected officials announce proposal to greatly expand reach of a measure mandating paid time off for sick workers; plan is a stark show of force by city's new liberal establishment and first in a series of labor- and immigrant-friendly laws that Mayor Bill de Blasio is expected to champion.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and KATE TAYLOR
byline.contributor: Eli Rosenberg and Rachel L. Swarns contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The plan is the first in a series of labor- and immigrant-friendly laws that Mayor Bill de Blasio is expected to champion, including higher pay for employees on many city-sponsored projects.

headline.main: Leaders Begin City’s Left Turn With Sick Pay Proposal
headline.print_headline: Leaders Begin City’s Left Turn With Sick Pay
